column4: now i'm dl'ing a ubuntu 8.04 cd and gonna try and reinstall network manager off of it
apt?
oops yeah, forgot the sudo
lol thxs
it says it reloaded it
hold on let me try something
crap, if i unplug thic pc to check my lappy then i'll lose you guys
brb k? lol thxs
should i restart before trying to connect to something again?
no. this is not windows we don't restart unless absolutely necessary
packages.ubuntu.com has all the files you need. download the .deb file and use dpkg -i package-name.deb to install
remember to change directory to where the .deb is saved. probably cd Desktop
dpkg - i will tell you what other files are needed if any and report it back to you as an error
that is dpkg -i ( the command ) hehe not I as in me
if other files are needed, same process as before download and use dpkg -i filename.deb filename2.deb filename3.deb
ok it is auto installing. good
if it did not ask for any other packages ( issue warning/ error ) then you don't
you can if you like but probably don't need to
right click on the top panel and Add to panel
scroll down to the network manager and add it to your panel
